materials.raw_text:
Cobalt(II) oxide (CoO) - 100 g 
 Gadolinium(III) oxide (Gd2O3) - 150 g 
 Phosphorus pentoxide (P2O5) - 50 g 
 Distilled water - 200 g

sourcing.instructions:
Cobalt(II) oxide can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online retailers. 
 Gadolinium(III) oxide is available from specialized suppliers or online. 
 Phosphorus pentoxide can be found in chemical supply shops or online. 
 Distilled water can be obtained from grocery stores or pharmacies.

preparation.raw_text:
1. In a clean glass container, weigh 100 g of Cobalt(II) oxide. 
 2. Add 150 g of Gadolinium(III) oxide to the container. 
 3. Weigh 50 g of Phosphorus pentoxide and add it to the mixture. 
 4. Gradually add 200 g of distilled water while stirring continuously to ensure even distribution of the powders. 
 5. Stir the mixture until a uniform slurry forms.
